title: War in Ukraine: In Kharkiv, bombed by the Russian army, 'everyone here has a cousin in Russia'
summary: Many residents of Kharkiv, where a Russian strike killed five people on August 30, have relatives on the other side of the border, just a few dozen kilometers away. Some are estranged, others are still in touch, but the wounds run deep and families are being torn apart.

title: Biden, Starmer discuss Ukraine missiles as Russia tensions mount
summary: US officials believe the missiles would make a limited difference to Ukraine's campaign and also want to ensure that Washington's own stocks of the munitions are not depleted. Ukraine and the United States's allies are all anxiously waiting for the result of a tense US presidential election in November that could upend Washington's Ukraine policy.

title: French ex-PM Gabriel Attal visits Ukraine in search of his independence and his Odesa castles
summary: Gabriel Attal arrived in Ukraine on Friday, for a visit that is both political and personal. His mother is descended from a noble family from the shores of the Black Sea, once forced to flee the Bolsheviks.

title: 2024 Paralympic Games: Investigation launched into the disappearance of three Congolese athletes
summary: Congo's only representatives at the Paralympic Games have not been heard from since September 5.

title: Why the French are having fewer children
summary: France's fertility rate, which measures the number of children per woman, has fallen from 2.03 in 2010 to 1.68 in 2023, below the threshold of 2.1 needed to sustain population replacement. Family policies have not reversed this trend.

title: Brazil judge seizes $3 million from Musk to pay X fines
summary: Last month, Judge Alexandre de Moraes ordered an X shutdown in Brazil after Musk refused to remove dozens of right-wing accounts and then failed to name a new legal representative in the country as ordered.

title: Racial questions take center stage at the Deauville American Film Festival
summary: Five films focused on African-American characters in deeply personal moments, including Nnamdi Asomugha's spellbinding 'The Knife'

title: South Sudan postpones December elections by 2 years citing incomplete preparations
summary: This is the second time the country, which gained independence in 2011, is postponing elections and extending a transitional period that started in February 2020. South Sudan has gone through the shocks of civil war, climate change and needs humanitarian aid with an estimated 9 million people, which is 73% of the country’s population, projected to require humanitarian assistance during 2024.

title: Paris 2024: Swimmer Oleksandr Komarov, pride of Ukraine and voice of Mariupol
summary: The 36-year-old athlete, triple medalist at the Paris Paralympic Games and flag-bearer at the closing ceremony, lived through the 2022 siege of his home port city.

title: Four IS group leaders killed in Iraq raid last month: CENTCOM
summary: The United States has some 2,500 troops in Iraq and 900 in Syria as part of the international coalition against the Islamic State group.

title: In Afghanistan, the Taliban's stranglehold, captured in Hashem Shakeri's photos
summary: Despite the tightening of entry conditions for foreign journalists in Afghanistan since the Taliban seized power on August 15, 2021, the Iranian photographer managed to enter the country up until 2023. His images show youth deprived of a future and all forms of freedom.

title: Artistic director of Paris 2024 Thomas Jolly: 'We showed and treated plurality without ever neglecting singularity'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the director of the opening and closing ceremonies of the 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games looks back on his adventure.

title: Boeing, already weakened by its industrial setbacks, faces a massive strike
summary: The industrial action for substantial wage increases, voted for by 96% of the 33,000 employees at the Everett and Renton plants, is likely to cost the US aircraft manufacturer several billion dollars.

title: 'Only Murders in the Building,' season 4, on Disney+: Trio of amateur detectives return under the Hollywood lights
summary: The comedy whose guilty pleasure is to suffer from an overflow of good ideas returns for 10 new episodes, all under the guise of cinematic illusion.

title: Brigitte Macron enjoys a selfie in 'Emily in Paris'
summary: France's first lady makes a brief appearance in season 4 of the Netflix series.

title: Pope Francis criticizes both US presidential candidates for anti-life policies
summary: The Argentine Jesuit, when asked to advise American Catholic voters, criticized both candidates for their stances on abortion and migration, and urged voters to choose the 'lesser evil.'

title: UNRWA says staffer killed in Israeli West Bank raid
summary: The UN agency for Palestinian refugees said that this was the first time in over a decade that one of its staff members had been killed in the occupied region.

title: Boeing workers overwhelmingly vote to strike
summary: Boeing workers reject a contract they say is less generous than promised.

title: The recovered picture of Raoul Minot, the mysterious photographer of occupied Paris
summary: Following the publication of a series of articles looking for this man who risked everything to capture some 700 photos of occupied Paris between 1940 and 1942, Le Monde was able to retrieve the only image missing from this story: his own.

title: Harris says she is different from Biden because 'I offer a new generation of leadership'
summary: Of her opponent, the VP said, 'I think people are more willing now, in light of the hate and division that we see coming out of Donald Trump to say, 'Hey, let’s put country first' and I think that just makes us stronger and more healthy as a country.'

title: In Greenland, the fall of a huge glacier a year ago triggered a nine-day global seismic signal
summary: A study published in 'Science' links a landslide to a tsunami in eastern Greenland in September 2023.

title: Russia launches counteroffensive in Kursk region
summary: The Russian army recaptured several villages on the western flank of the territory conquered by Kyiv in early August. Kyiv is calling on the West to let it strike deep into Russian territory with its weapons.

title: Paris 2024: See Céline Dion and Aya Nakamura's opening ceremony dresses up close
summary: All the Dior numbers that lit up the Paris sky on July 26 can be admired at La Galerie Dior in Paris.

title: France to bid farewell to Olympic Games with parade on Champs-Elysées
summary: Athletes, volunteers, and workers will parade on the Champs-Elysées on Saturday evening, in a celebration that will include a concert at the Arc de Triomphe monument.

title: Pope Francis says Vatican knew for years about Abbé Pierre's sexual assaults
summary: The head of the Catholic Church acknowledged that Rome had been aware of the recently reported sexual violence perpetrated by the famous French priest at least since his death in 2007.

title: Typhoon Yagi's devastating consequences in 15 photos
summary: Four days after the passage of Typhoon Yagi, Vietnam, Myanmar and Thailand can only observe the extent of the damage. The latest regional death toll is at least 280.

title: President of Comoros 'slightly injured' in knife attack
summary: Azali Assoumani's injuries were not serious, his office said. The attacker was arrested.

title: Biden administration, behind declared solidarity with Ukraine, harbors hesitations
summary: The US has been reluctant to allow Kyiv to strike Russia with the long-range missiles its allies have supplied, fearing it might lead to escalation with Moscow.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'The Draghi report is a step in the right direction'
summary: The report on competitiveness and the future of Europe submitted by the former ECB president has the advantage of challenging the dogma of budgetary austerity, writes the economist in his column.

title: Paris 2024 ceremony artists experienced their own 'Olympic effect'
summary: As preparations continue for the Paris 2024 final Olympic and Paralympic parade, scheduled for September 14, in Paris, musicians and artists share their experiences and the opportunities that followed their performances.

title: Comoros president's attacker found dead in prison next day
summary: President Azali Assoumani was 'slightly injured' injured in an attach on Friday. The attacker was arrested and died in prison the next day.

title: 'The political crisis since the dissolution marks a new stage in the RN's de-demonization'
summary: While the influence of Marine Le Pen's party is growing, the sociologist Nonna Mayer believes that this rise needs to be put into perspective and, above all, can be curbed, provided that other political players adjust their strategies.

title: Ukraine's legalization of medical cannabis is a source of hope for veterans
summary: A medical and social revolution, the authorization of the plant's use for medicinal purposes could bring relief to soldiers suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder and amputees.

title: Storm Boris sweeps through eastern and central Europe
summary: The storm has triggered floods, unusually strong winds and torrential rains across areas of Austria, the Czech Republic, Hungary, Slovakia, Poland, and Romania, where the flooding has claimed lives and damaged thousands of homes.

title: The mosquito war between the two Koreas
summary: The demilitarized zone, a no man's land along the border between South and North Korea, is at the heart of a new battle. Seoul is deploying an anti-mosquito arsenal to protect itself from malaria, a disease that is endemic in the neighboring country.

title: Syria's president al-Assad names former minister head of government
summary: The new Syrian government, to be formed by former communications minister Mohammed Ghazi Jalali, who is under EU sanctions, is set to end the country's caretaker government period, which has gone on since the mid-July parliamentary elections.

title: Uganda holds funeral for murdered Olympian Rebecca Cheptegei
summary: The 33-year-old long-distance runner, who had died after being set on fire by her partner, was given a military funeral, including a gun salute. Her death has thrown a spotlight on what activists have called a femicide epidemic.

title: Thousands in France march in support of Gisèle Pelicot and protest of 'rape culture'
summary: Protesters took to the streets across the country in solidarity with the woman who was drugged by her husband for nearly ten years so he and other men could rape her in her sleep.

title: Who is the businessman plastering Paris with ads for his concert you can't attend?
summary: Omar Harfouch, a businessman with a mysterious fortune, will play the piano at the Théâtre des Champs-Elysées in Paris for his 'Concerto for Peace.' He financed the promotional campaign, but no tickets are on sale.

title: Le Pen 'convinced' there will be new elections next year
summary: Just over two months after France's parliamentary elections led to a three-way split in the Assemblée National, far-right leader Marine Le Pen said the situation is 'untenable' and expects President Emmanuel Macron to call new elections as soon the Constitution allows, in 10 months.

title: Three Americans, two Spaniards held over alleged plot to attack Maduro and 'destabilize' Venezuela
summary: Interior Minister Diosdado Cabello said that the five were held on suspicion of planning an attack on President Nicolas Maduro and his government.

title: 'We are all Gisèle!': Feminist rallies across France in response to the Mazan rape trial
summary: In Paris, Bordeaux and Strasbourg on Saturday, thousands of people showed their support for Gisèle Pelicot and all rape victims. The leitmotif of this mobilization: 'shame must change sides.'

title: #MeToo for men: 'I'm a 9-year-old boy, he comes into my room, he rapes me, 43 years of silence'
summary: Writers, TV presenters, politicians... Following years of silence, men are finding the courage to speak out about the sexual violence they have suffered. This quiet breaking of silence began six months ago in France with the hashtag #MeTooGarçons.
